item.title: Another rubbish bag dumped, 18th February
item.description:

item.title: Severe Litter & Waste Accumulation – Bermondsey Street, 18th February
item.description:
I am reporting the unacceptable state of cleanliness across the entire Bermondsey Street area. There is widespread litter daily, including plastic bags, loose food waste, household rubbish, and restaurant/commercial bins left on pavements. Bags and bins are frequently left open or torn apart, with food waste spread across the street. This is causing serious odours, attracting vermin, and represents a clear public health hazard. Urgent action is required to increase street cleaning and enforce proper waste management.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116-118, Bermondsey Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 18th February
item.description:
Thus vehicle was left in Stonegate Close coming up 4 weeks ago, a man drove the car into the close, got into a silver astra and drove out the close and hasn't been back since. The man does not live in Stonegate Close and the vehicle is taking up space when parking for residents is already limited. The vehicle is untaxed and does not have an MOT.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stonegate Close, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain in Tottenhall Road, 18th February
item.description:
This drain seems to be blocked with mud & there is a lot of mud along the edge of the road which is washing even more mud into it with all the heavy rain. It is in Tottenhall Rd near the junction with Pasteur Gardens & opposite Beale Close flats

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tottenhall Road, Palmers Green
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street sign, 18th February
item.description:
Street sign has been on the ground for at least 6 months to a year. First reported August last year then it was sort of propped up. Reported again in August and September. If you’re not going to fix it then remove the sign from the ground please.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Strongbow Crescent, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
